content.Coding Conventions: This document outlines a collection of guidelines, style suggestions, and tips for writing code in the different programming languages used throughout the Kubernetes project.
content.Code Conventions: Ensure that build, release, test, and cluster-management scripts run on macOS. Comment your code. Command-line flags should use dashes, not underscores. Naming conventions for packages and locks.
content.Testing Conventions: All new packages and most new significant functionality must come with unit tests. Table-driven tests are preferred. Significant features should come with integration and/or end-to-end tests. Avoid relying on Docker Hub.
content.Directory and File Conventions: Avoid package sprawl. Libraries with no appropriate home belong in new package subdirectories of pkg/util. All filenames should be lowercase. Go source files and directories use underscores, not dashes.

content.Code Contribution: This includes modified third-party code and excerpts, as well.
